Improved communication: Women are traditionally known to have better communication skills than men. If all world leaders were women, there might be an improvement in communication, leading to better cooperation and understanding between different countries.
Lower conflict rates: Women are typically less likely to engage in conflict than men. If all world leaders were women, there might be a decrease in global conflict and a more peaceful world.

Improved education: Women are often more vocal about education and may prioritize education as a key focus of their leadership. If all world leaders were women, there might be a greater emphasis on education, leading to increased literacy rates and better educational opportunities for everyone.

More inclusive policies: Women leaders are often more likely to prioritize social issues such as LGBTQ+ rights, immigration reform, and racial equality. If all world leaders were women, there might be more inclusive policies that address these issues.

Shift in power dynamics: If all world leaders were women, there might be a shift in power dynamics, leading to greater diversity and representation in leadership positions. This could help to reduce gender bias and promote a more equitable society.
